programme.desc: When Tommy and Tallulah agree to babysit the spring chicks while Madame Au Lait tends to Mother Chicks hurt wing, they dont realise that how much of a handful the chicks will be. The twins are also taking part in the town kite display today, but somehow the chicks end up surfing on their kite, high in the sky! The twins must stage an airborne rescue before Chime Time.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah are organising McCogginss pile of interesting junk when a vitally important spring goes missing. They cant chime the time without it! The twins chase the spring all over town as it bounces around causing chaos, eventually ending up attaching Pufferty to his kennel. Every time he tries to go somewhere, the spring pulls him back.

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: McCoggins tells the twins not to stray far, but they forget to warn Pufferty when they try to teach him how to play hide and seek. There are not many places in Tickety Town big enough to hide a huge dog train, so Pufferty heads far off into the hills. Where can he be? The race is on to find him by Chime Time.

programme.sub-title: The Story of Alfie and Charlies Canoe

programme.sub-title: The Story of Confuse-Us the Carp

programme.title: 64 Zoo Lane

When Cassandra announces that autumn is almost here and she will soon leave, Bao Bao is upset at her imminent departure and prepares himself for life without her. Bao Bao learns that Cassandra is only leaving for the winter months, and he should make the most of her company while he can.

She heads off on her own, and soon the other animals are intrigued by the strange bouncy boingy noises that can be heard across the savannah.

programme.title: Monkey Life

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp Bens mysterious infection has spread to some of the others in his group, and its a race against time to diagnose and treat it effectively. programme.title: Monkey Life

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Palau, a tiny island nation in the middle of the western Pacific ocean, is a land of giants. Large manta rays soar through its azure seas. Massive Second World War wrecks harbour dark secrets on the ocean floor. The archipelago is surrounded by a colossal underwater trench that reaches more than half a mile down into unseen depths. Its reef, one the largest living structures on the planet, is home to more than 1,500 species of fish.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp Ben has a nasty infection and animal director Jeremy is worried it may lead to him losing his foot. Meanwhile, in Paddys chimp troop, it may be his dad who is the boss, but baby Bart is realising that he is pretty important too. Elsewhere, golden-cheeked gibbon Tien has undergone a transformation, and keeper Holly checks up on Xuzy.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp Bens mysterious infection has spread to some of the others in his group, and its a race against time to diagnose and treat it effectively. Meanwhile, the orang-utans are watching their weight, but are not so keen to get onto the scales. Plus, the lemurs and stump-tailed macaques meet for the first time - could they become housemates?

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp Bens foot infection has led to the amputation of one of his toes. Just as hes improving, Honey, one of the chimps in Hananyas house, is struck down by the mysterious bacterial infection - and it is serious.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: A biologist searches for a giant otter den at the southern edge of the Brazilian Pantanal.

programme.title: Bugs That Rule the World
programme.desc: The ruthless realm of some of the stealthiest and cleverest insects in the animal kingdom -- from praying mantises and aquatic insects to dragonflies.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Palau, a tiny island nation in the middle of the western Pacific ocean, is a land of giants. Large manta rays soar through its azure seas. Massive Second World War wrecks harbour dark secrets on the ocean floor. The archipelago is surrounded by a colossal underwater trench that reaches more than half a mile down into unseen depths. Its reef, one the largest living structures on the planet, is home to more than 1,500 species of fish.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: There is a scuffle between the female capuchins, Tia needs surgery, and orang-utan Amy is heavily pregnant - and very grumpy. Meanwhile, there is something new in the play area of the chimp nursery, and Alison has her last visit with Paulo, the baby woolly monkey she has successfully reared by hand.

programme.desc: Chimp Ben has a nasty infection and animal director Jeremy is worried it may lead to him losing his foot. Meanwhile, in Paddys chimp troop, it may be his dad who is the boss, but baby Bart is realising that he is pretty important too. programme.desc: Chimp Bens foot infection has led to the amputation of one of his toes. Just as hes improving, Honey, one of the chimps in Hananyas house, is struck down by the mysterious bacterial infection - and it is serious.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Geoffroys marmoset males Cesar and Gizmo could soon have female partners, but first, a minor operation is required.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: S18/Ep14 - Alison collects Angel, a marmoset in need of a new home and partner. A move to Malagasy for the new male lemurs and the old guard causes a bit of a stink. (S18, ep 14)

programme.title: Wild Dogs
programme.desc: Discover the ways in which natural selection and human pressure have shaped the raccoon dog, the golden jackal and the maned wolf.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Palau, a tiny island nation in the middle of the western Pacific ocean, is a land of giants. Large manta rays soar through its azure seas. Its reef, one the largest living structures on the planet, is home to more than 1,500 species of fish.

programme.title: Africas Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: In one of Africas greatest lakes, rock and water set the stage for evolutions most magnificent display. This episode tells the story of this remarkable example of evolution in action, as well as showing how the lake provides for a range of life, both above and below the surface.

programme.title: Secret World of Sound with David Attenborough
programme.desc: From melodic songs to strange hums, David Attenborough sets out to discover the sounds that gibbons, lyrebirds, bull elk, and more use to find a mate and warn off the competition.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: One of the most majestic, unspoiled and rarely filmed areas in Africa is an exploration of how wildlife including cheetahs, hyenas and elephants survive the cycles of draught and rainfall.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Geoffroys marmoset males Cesar and Gizmo could soon have female partners, but first, a minor operation is required.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: A biologist searches for a giant otter den at the southern edge of the Brazilian Pantanal.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: One of the most majestic, unspoiled and rarely filmed areas in Africa is an exploration of how wildlife including cheetahs, hyenas and elephants survive the cycles of draught and rainfall.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Muellers gibbons Adidas and Dalumie head for the treetops for the first time, while Peanut, Pung-Yo and Tien, the endangered golden-cheeked gibbons, move into the enclosure next door. Plus, a specialist doctor is called in when Freddys bowel complaint fails to improve.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison Cronin travels to Monkey Worlds new endangered primate sanctuary in Vietnam, and meets the newest resident of the centre, Ellie the young golden-cheeked gibbon. Meanwhile, the team learn that two rare monkeys are being kept in a theme park outside Ho Chi Minh City, and attempt to get them freed.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Stump-tailed macaque Jonathan has to get some sun cream, as the high-ranking members of the troop have over groomed him and he has gone bald. Meanwhile, the park is saddened by the death of alpha male capuchin Tom, who was at the centre for seven years. Elsewhere, the chimps are given walnuts and Jestah gets more than his fair share.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Disturbing footage convinces Alison to rescue an adult female chimpanzee working in the tourist industry in Mexico, who urgently needs the teams help. Elsewhere, even Lulu joins in the fun when the nursery chimps have a play session, and Kai tries to act independent and grown up while discouraging Amy from joining in his games.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: An examination of the 80 mammal species, 650 bird species, 50 reptile species and more than 300 fish species that inhabit the Pantanal.

programme.title: Bugs That Rule the World
programme.desc: The crucial ecological roles that beetles play in nearly every environment, and why they are often regarded "the most important species on the planet."

programme.title: Secret World of Sound with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough follows baby animals as they communicate in their quest for survival, using sound to beg and call for help in the vulnerable early days of life in the natural world.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.sub-title: Indonesia: The Secret Life of Manta Rays
programme.desc: The remote islands of Raja Ampat in the Indonesian archipelago are home to a diversity of marine life, including the secretive giants of the ocean, manta rays. A team of researchers from Conservation International heads out on an expedition to learn more about the biology, population size and migration patterns of these astonishing animals to protect them from overfishing outside of marine-protected areas.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Waters
programme.desc: Venture along Earths coasts, where colliding worlds create a melting pot of biodiversity. Watch orcas hunt with precision, hold on as guillemot chicks take leaps of faith, crawl to safety with turtle hatchlings, and see crabs sculpt sandy galaxies.

programme.desc: Across land, sea and sky, animals follow the Moons hidden forces to navigate epic journeys across the planet.

programme.title: Africas Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: Off the coast of Mozambique, warm water surrounds idyllic islands. In this shallow realm, sunlight fuels abundant growth. Rich sea currents carry food and inundate underwater meadows. Life in many forms crowds the space between seabed and surface.

programme.title: Wild Dogs
programme.desc: Discover how natural selection and human-made pressures are affecting and influencing canid species across the globe, like the raccoon dog, the golden jackal, and the maned wolf.

programme.title: Africas Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: Just off the Tanzanian coastline lies an island Utopia. Its diverse habitats provide homes for a multitude of creatures living above the water and below. And when the time is right, a mysterious being rises from the deep to feed in the rich waters. This is Mafia Island.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Numerous species, including giant anteaters, maned wolves and the greater rhea, flock to the grasslands of the Pantanal during the dry season.

programme.title: Africas Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: Off the coast of Mozambique, warm water surrounds idyllic islands. In this shallow realm, sunlight fuels abundant growth. Rich sea currents carry food and inundate underwater meadows. Life in many forms crowds the space between seabed and surface.

programme.title: Secret World of Sound with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough follows baby animals as they communicate in their quest for survival, using sound to beg and call for help in the vulnerable early days of life in the natural world.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: One of the most majestic, unspoiled and rarely filmed areas in Africa is an exploration of how wildlife including cheetahs, hyenas and elephants survive the cycles of draught and rainfall.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Waters
programme.desc: Venture along Earths coasts, where colliding worlds create a melting pot of biodiversity. Watch orcas hunt with precision, hold on as guillemot chicks take leaps of faith, crawl to safety with turtle hatchlings, and see crabs sculpt sandy galaxies.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is selected to travel to France with a group of local WWII veterans, but after seeing how scruffy he looks, the organisers withdraw the offer. Meanwhile, Edies estranged sister Ros returns looking to make amends.

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville is forced into taking extra security precautions for the shops takings which cause him a no end of discomfort, and Eric suffers a curious injury.

programme.title: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: Wallace and Gromit have opened a new bakery and business is booming, not least because a deadly Cereal Killer has murdered all the other bakers in town. Gromit is worried that they may be next but Wallace does not care as he has fallen in love.

programme.title: Dinnerladies
programme.desc: Has poor Bren blown her chance with Tony? Anita has left her inflatable man behind.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve, and at the Goods house, Tom and Barbara are making decorations and crackers ready for Christmas Day, while at the Leadbetters, Margo has sent back her whole order because her Christmas tree is six and a quarter inches too short. However, when the company does not deliver her order the following day, she and Jerry are left with no decorations, food or drink. Can there be anything worse?

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring tries to get out of attending a big church parade when the Home Guard are ordered to wear their medals from previous conflicts. The trouble is, Mainwaring hasnt got any.

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Alice has worked out the clues in `The Da Vinci Code and concluded, somewhat worryingly, that she is the last living descendant of Jesus Christ. Meanwhile, the Vicar is fed up with rich townies buying weekend cottages in her beloved Dibley - until she meets one of them. Could Harry possibly be her Mr Right? Unlike every other villager hes not insane and has his own teeth.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is a Mammy on a mission - trying to make sure grandson Bono isnt sent to the infamous local primary school (despite what his parents want) and as if her house isnt normally noisy enough, she finds herself lumbered with a brand new house guest in the form of a homeless parrot. At least shes got her New Years Eve party to look forward to - until her guests start dropping like flies. Suddenly it looks like she might be seeing in the New Year without her family around her.

programme.desc: Festive special. Inspired by Nigella Lawson, Denise decides to cook Christmas dinner for the family. Jim provides the Yuletide log and, much to his dismay, Daves mum and dad are invited to join in with the festivities. What could possible go wrong?

programme.desc: Wallace and Gromit have opened a new bakery and business is booming, not least because a deadly Cereal Killer has murdered all the other bakers in town. Gromit is worried that they may be next but Wallace does not care as he has fallen in love.

programme.title: Dinnerladies
programme.desc: Has poor Bren blown her chance with Tony? Anita has left her inflatable man behind.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve, and at the Goods house, Tom and Barbara are making decorations and crackers ready for Christmas Day, while at the Leadbetters, Margo has sent back her whole order because her Christmas tree is six and a quarter inches too short. However, when the company does not deliver her order the following day, she and Jerry are left with no decorations, food or drink. Can there be anything worse?

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring tries to get out of attending a big church parade when the Home Guard are ordered to wear their medals from previous conflicts. The trouble is, Mainwaring hasnt got any.

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Alice has worked out the clues in `The Da Vinci Code and concluded, somewhat worryingly, that she is the last living descendant of Jesus Christ. Meanwhile, the Vicar is fed up with rich townies buying weekend cottages in her beloved Dibley - until she meets one of them. Could Harry possibly be her Mr Right? Unlike every other villager hes not insane and has his own teeth.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is a Mammy on a mission - trying to make sure grandson Bono isnt sent to the infamous local primary school (despite what his parents want) and as if her house isnt normally noisy enough, she finds herself lumbered with a brand new house guest in the form of a homeless parrot. At least shes got her New Years Eve party to look forward to - until her guests start dropping like flies. Suddenly it looks like she might be seeing in the New Year without her family around her.

programme.desc: Festive special. Inspired by Nigella Lawson, Denise decides to cook Christmas dinner for the family. Jim provides the Yuletide log and, much to his dismay, Daves mum and dad are invited to join in with the festivities. What could possible go wrong?

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts travel to Wightwick Manor near Wolverhampton as they delve into thousands of family treasures. Objects featured include remnants of German parachute silk used in World War Two to make silk knickers, and a rare piece of early English glass. Plus famous cricketer Ted Dexter brings a special piece with surprising family history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce looks back on another vintage year for the `Antiques Roadshow. As experts choose their favourite finds, there are updates on what has happened to the objects since they first appeared. Some have gone on to be sold, whilst others have been loaned for exhibitions in the UK and even abroad, as a British flag captured by the Japanese during the fall of Singapore in World War Two is returned.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
